action.action-desc: Mr. Hawley introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To require the Administrator of General Services to display or inscribe the national motto of the United States on all Federal buildings, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the In God We Trust Act.

section.header: Display of national motto on Federal buildings

subsection.text: In this section, the term public building has the meaning given the term in section 3301(a) of title 40, United States Code.

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of General Services shall inscribe or display in a place of prominence on every public building the national motto of the United States, as described in section 302 of title 36, United States Code.
